SEARCH
Package org.projectsw.Controller

Class Engine

java.lang.Object
org.projectsw.Controller.Engine
public class Engine extends Object
The class contains the application logic methods of the game.

    • getPlayerFromNickname

      public Player getPlayerFromNickname(String nickname)
      Retrieves the player object associated with the specified nickname.
      Parameters:
      nickname - The nickname of the player to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      The Player object with the specified nickname, or null if no player is found with the given nickname.

    • saveFileFound

      public boolean saveFileFound()
      Checks if a save file exists and returns the result. This method creates a new instance of the SaveGameStatus class, passing the game object and the file path as parameters, and calls the checkExistingSaveFile() method to determine if a save file exists.
      Returns:
      true if a save file exists, false otherwise.

    • retrieveGame

      public Game retrieveGame()
      Retrieves the saved game from the existing save file. This method creates a new instance of the SaveGameStatus class, passing the game object and the file path as parameters, and calls the retrieveGame() method to retrieve the game data from the save file.
      Returns:
      The retrieved Game object from the save file.

    • setGame

      public void setGame(Game activeGame)
      Sets the active game to the specified Game object.
      Parameters:
      activeGame - The Game object to be set as the active game.

    • getSaveGameStatus

      public SaveGameStatus getSaveGameStatus()
      Returns the current value of the saveGameStatus variable.
      Returns:
      The current value of the saveGameStatus variable.

    • setSaveGameStatus

      public void setSaveGameStatus(SaveGameStatus saveGameStatus)
      Sets the saveGameStatus to the specified saveGameStatus object.
      Parameters:
      saveGameStatus - The saveGameStatus object to be set as the active game.

    • playerJoin

      public void playerJoin(String nickname, String ID)
      Handles the process when a player joins the game. If the game is in the lobby state, the player is added to the game with the provided nickname and ID. If the player is the first one to join, they become the first player and the current player. Other players are notified of the new player's arrival if the game has not reached the maximum number of players. Any existing players beyond the maximum are marked for removal. The player's nickname and ID are stored in the ID_Nicks map. If the game reaches the maximum number of players and is still in the lobby state, the game is started. If the game is not in the lobby state, the player is removed as an observer and their ID is removed from the ID_Nicks map.
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname of the player
      ID - the ID of the player

    • smallJoin

      public void smallJoin(String nickname)
      Performs a small join operation by adding a new player to the game with the specified nickname. This method creates a new Player object with the given nickname and assigns it the position equal to the current number of players in the game. The new player is then added to the game.
      Parameters:
      nickname - The nickname of the player to be added.

    • startGame

      public void startGame()
      Starts the game by changing the game state to "RUNNING", saving the game status, filling the board, notifying players of name colors, notifying the next player's turn, and notifying the nickname of the last player. The game status is saved to the specified file path.

    • selectTiles

      public void selectTiles(String ID, Point selectedPoint)
      Handles the selection of tiles by a player. If the selected point is already in the temporary points list, the tiles are deselected. Otherwise, if the selection is possible, the selected point is added to the temporary points list, the selectable points on the board are updated, and the updated board is sent to the observers. If there are no selectable points left or the player's shelf has reached maximum capacity, an error message indicating the selection is not possible is sent to the observers. If the selected tile is not selectable, an error message is sent to the observers. Finally, a flag indicating the completion of the selection process is sent to the observers.
      Parameters:
      ID - the ID of the player
      selectedPoint - the selected point on the board

    • deselectTiles

      public void deselectTiles(Point point)
      Remove the given point from the temporaryPoints list.
      Parameters:
      point - the point to remove.

    • confirmSelectedTiles

      public void confirmSelectedTiles(String ID)
      Confirms the selection of tiles by a player. If the temporary points list is empty, an error message indicating empty temporary points is sent to the observers. Otherwise, the tiles corresponding to the selected points are added to the player's temporary tiles list, the temporary points list is cleared, and the selectable columns on the player's shelf are updated. The temporary tiles are then transferred to the appropriate destination.
      Parameters:
      ID - the ID of the player

    • selectColumn

      public void selectColumn(String ID, Integer index)
      Selects a column on the player's shelf. If the player's shelf allows for column selection: If no column is currently selected, the specified column index is set as the selected column. If a column is already selected, it is deselected. Finally, a flag indicating the completion of the selection process is sent to the observers.
      Parameters:
      ID - the ID of the player
      index - the index of the column to select

    • placeTiles

      public void placeTiles(String ID, Integer temporaryIndex)
      Places a tile from the player's temporary tiles onto the player's shelf. The selection possibility on the player's shelf is set to false to prevent further tile placement. The tile at the specified temporary index is selected from the player's temporary tiles. The selected column on the shelf is obtained. Starting from the bottom row of the shelf, the method searches for the first non-empty tile in the selected column. If a non-empty tile is found, the tile to insert is placed one row above it (if possible), and the updated shelf and tiles are sent to the observers. If the search reaches the top row without finding a non-empty tile, the tile to insert is placed in the top row, and the updated shelf and tiles are sent to the observers. If the player no longer has any temporary tiles, the selected column is deselected, the selection possibility on the shelf is set to true, and a notification indicating the completion of the tile placement is sent to the observers. If the specified temporary index is invalid, an error message indicating an invalid temporary tile is sent to the observers. Finally, a flag indicating the completion of the method is sent to the observers.
      Parameters:
      ID - the ID of the player
      temporaryIndex - the index of the temporary tile to place

    • checkCommonGoals

      public void checkCommonGoals()
      Checks the common goals to see if any of them can be redeemed by the current player. If a common goal's requirements are met by the player's shelf and the goal has not been previously redeemed by the player, the player earns points based on the number of times the goal has been redeemed, and the goal's redeemed count is decreased. The player's points are updated accordingly, and the goal is marked as redeemed by the player.

    • sendResults

      public void sendResults(int forced)
      Sends the game results to the observers. The updated game state, including the results, is serialized and sent to the observers. A flag indicating the completion of the method is also sent to the observers. Any network errors that occur during the process are handled and an error message is thrown.

    • checkPersonalGoal

      public void checkPersonalGoal()
      Checks the personal goals of each player and updates their points based on the redeemed tiles. For each player, it compares their personal goal with the tiles on their shelf and counts the number of redeemed tiles. Based on the number of redeemed tiles, the player's points are updated accordingly.

    • checkEndgameGoal

      public void checkEndgameGoal()
      Checks the endgame goal for each player. Updates the player's points based on the completion of the endgame goal.

    • endTurn

      public void endTurn(String ID, String nickName)
      Ends the turn for the current player. Checks common goals and updates player points accordingly. Checks if the end game condition is met. Clears the temporary tiles of the current player. Refills the board if it is empty. Sets the next active player as the current player. If the current player is in the first position and the board is in the end game state, ends the game. Notifies the next active player and broadcasts the updated game state. Saves the game status.
      Parameters:
      ID - The ID of the player ending the turn.
      nickName - The nickname of the player ending the turn.

    • waitFor10Seconds

      public static void waitFor10Seconds()
      Pauses the execution for 10 seconds.

    • endTurnForced

      public void endTurnForced()
      Ends the turn forcefully for the current player in the game. This method performs the following actions: Clears the temporary tiles of the current player. Fills the board if it is empty. Sets the next player as the current player. Notifies the next player and updates the game state. Saves the game status. This method is synchronized to ensure thread safety.

    • checkEndGame

      public void checkEndGame(String ID, String nickName)
      Checks if the game should end based on the provided player ID and nickname. This method performs the following actions: Checks if the game has reached the end game state on the board. If the current player's shelf is full, sets the end game flag to true, increments the player's points, and notifies observers of the end game. If the provided nickname has a position greater than 0, sends force ending notifications to players with positions lower than the provided nickname's position. Notifies observers of the returned flag.
      Parameters:
      ID - the ID of the player
      nickName - the nickname of the player

    • endGame

      public void endGame()
      Ends the game. This method performs the following actions: Checks the personal goal. Checks the endgame goal. Deletes the save file.

    • sendChat

      public void sendChat(String scope, String ID)
      Sends a chat message within the specified scope. This method performs the following actions: Checks if the specified scope contains an invalid nickname. If the nickname is valid, sends the chat message to observers. If the nickname is invalid, sends an error message to observers. Notifies observers of the returned flag.
      Parameters:
      scope - the scope of the chat message
      ID - the ID of the player

    • sayInChat

      public void sayInChat(String sender, String content, String scope, String ID)
      Sends a chat message from the specified sender with the given content and scope. This method performs the following actions: Checks if the scope is an error scope. If so, sends an error message to observers. Checks if the scope contains an invalid nickname. If so, sends an error message to observers. Adds the chat message to the chat log. Sends the chat message to observers.
      Parameters:
      sender - the nickname of the sender
      content - the content of the chat message
      scope - the scope of the chat message
      ID - the ID of the player

    • removeObserver

      public void removeObserver(String id, int num)
      Removes an observer with the specified ID and number from the game. This method performs the following actions: Decrements the counter. Notifies observers of the observer's removal. Deletes the observer from the game. Removes the observer from the clientObserverHashMap. Removes the ID from the Clients_ID map. Removes the ID from the ID_Nicks map.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the observer
      num - the number of the observer

    • everlastingKill

      public void everlastingKill()
      Performs an everlasting kill by notifying all observers of the kill event. This method performs the following actions: Notifies observers of the kill event with a broadcast ID and a dummy number.

    • fillBoard

      public void fillBoard()
      Fills the board if the board contains only tiles with no other adjacent tiles.

    • initializeFromSave

      public void initializeFromSave(String ID)
      Initializes the game from a saved state. This method performs the following actions: Retrieves the saved game. Sets the game state and related properties from the saved game. Updates the necessary flags and variables. Notifies observers of the option choice and the returned flag.
      Parameters:
      ID - the ID of the player

    • setIsActiveFromClient

      public void setIsActiveFromClient(Client client, Boolean choice)
      Sets the active status of a player based on the client's choice.
      Parameters:
      client - the client for which to set the active status
      choice - the choice indicating whether the player is active or not

    • getNickFromClient

      public String getNickFromClient(Client client)
      Retrieves the nickname associated with a client.
      Parameters:
      client - the client for which to retrieve the nickname
      Returns:
      the nickname associated with the client

    • takeNick

      public void takeNick(SerializableInput input)
      Handles the process of assigning a nickname to a client. If the client's alphanumeric ID matches the first client's ID: If loading from a saved game, attempts to load the game with the provided nickname. If not loading from a saved game, checks if the nickname is already taken. If not, initializes the player with the nickname. If the client's alphanumeric ID does not match the first client's ID: If not loading from a saved game and the first player is not yet assigned, checks if the nickname is already taken. If not, assigns the nickname to the client. If loading from a saved game, attempts to load the game with the provided nickname.
      Parameters:
      input - the input containing the client's alphanumeric ID and nickname

    • Connect

      public void Connect(String alphanumericID) throws RemoteException, InterruptedException
      Connects a client to the game.
      Parameters:
      alphanumericID - the alphanumeric ID of the client
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if a network error occurs during the connection process
      InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted while waiting for the connection

    • setNumberOfPlayers

      public void setNumberOfPlayers(int numberOfPlayers, String ID)
      Sets the number of players for the game and initializes the game state. This method is called when the number of players is chosen by the first client. The game is initialized with the specified number of players. The option chosen flag is set to true, indicating that the number of players has been selected. The game state is sent to the clients.
      Parameters:
      numberOfPlayers - The number of players for the game.
      ID - The alphanumeric ID of the client.

    • boardTransfer

      public void boardTransfer(String ID)
      Transfers the game board to the client identified by the specified ID. This method sends the game board to the client and notifies the client that the board has been transferred. If there is a network error during the process, the client observer is removed.
      Parameters:
      ID - The alphanumeric ID of the client.

    • shelfTransfer

      public void shelfTransfer(String clientNickname, String ID)
      Transfers the game shelf to the client identified by the specified ID. This method sends the game shelf to the client and notifies the client that the board has been transferred. If there is a network error during the process, the client observer is removed.
      Parameters:
      ID - The alphanumeric ID of the client.

    • shelfTransferAll

      public void shelfTransferAll(String ID)
      Transfers all the game shelves to the client identified by the specified ID. This method sends the all game shelves to the client and notifies the client that the board has been transferred.
      Parameters:
      ID - The alphanumeric ID of the client.

    • personalGoalTransfer

      public void personalGoalTransfer(String ID, String nickname)
      Transfers the game personal Goal to the client identified by the specified ID. This method sends the game personal Goal to the client and notifies the client that the board has been transferred.
      Parameters:
      ID - The alphanumeric ID of the client.

    • temporaryTilesTransfer

      public void temporaryTilesTransfer(String ID)
      Transfers the game temporary Tiles to the client identified by the specified ID. This method sends the game temporary Tiles to the client and notifies the client that the board has been transferred.
      Parameters:
      ID - The alphanumeric ID of the client.

    • commonGoalTransfer

      public void commonGoalTransfer(String ID)
      Transfers the game common Goal to the client identified by the specified ID. This method sends the game common Goal to the client and notifies the client that the board has been transferred.
      Parameters:
      ID - The alphanumeric ID of the client.

    • currentPlayerTransfer

      public void currentPlayerTransfer(String ID)
      Transfers the game current Player to the client identified by the specified ID. This method sends the game current Player to the client and notifies the client that the board has been transferred.
      Parameters:
      ID - The alphanumeric ID of the client.

    • reconnectionCheck

      public void reconnectionCheck(String ID)
      Checks if any inactive player needs to reconnect. For each player in the game, if the player is inactive, it sends a request to the client identified by the specified ID to provide the nickname for reconnection. It also sets the playerReconnect flag to true.
      Parameters:
      ID - The alphanumeric ID of the client.

    • notActive

      public void notActive(SerializableInput input)
      Sets the isActive flag of the player with the specified nickname to false.
      Parameters:
      input - The input containing the client nickname.
